allow: Bash(# The issue is the cert bundle. Let''s download a newer one using git''s cert export PATH=""/c/php83:/c/ProgramData/ComposerSetup/bin:/mingw64/bin:/usr/bin:/usr/local/bin:/c/Windows/system32:$PATH"" # Git for Windows has its own CA bundle ls /mingw64/etc/ssl/certs/ca-bundle.crt || ls /mingw64/ssl/certs/ca-bundle.crt find /mingw64 -name ""ca-bundle*"" -o -name ""ca-certificates*"")

Bash(# Use openssl to get the full certificate chain export PATH=""/c/php83:/mingw64/bin:/usr/bin:/usr/local/bin:/c/Windows/system32:$PATH"" echo | openssl s_client -showcerts -connect repo.packagist.org:443)

Bash(# The openssl s_client works fine \(no AVG interception for Git''s openssl\) # AVG only intercepts PHP''s curl. Let''s clone Laravel via git instead export PATH=""/c/php83:/c/ProgramData/ComposerSetup/bin:/mingw64/bin:/usr/bin:/usr/local/bin:/c/Windows/system32:$PATH"" # First, check if we have the Laravel skeleton from the cache ls /tmp/laravel-temp/)
